books.title: The Autobiography of Malcolm X
author: Malcolm X
Alex Haley
books.description: The Autobiography of Malcolm X is an account of the life of Malcolm X, born Malcolm Little (1925–1965), who became a human rights activist

books.title: Ancillary Justice
author: Ann Leckie
books.description: On a remote, icy planet, the soldier known as Breq is drawing closer to completing her quest.

books.title: Screenplay
author: Syd Field
books.description: A generation of screenwriters has used Syd File's bestselling books to ignite successful careers in film

books.title: Not For Bread Alone
author: Ann Leckie
books.description: From one of the century's most accomplished business leaders comes a unique and profoundly thoughtful approach to financial and personal achievement.

books.title: Freedom from the Known
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
Mary Lutyens
books.description: Krishnamurti shows how people can free themselves radically and immediately from the tyranny of the expected, no matter what their age--opening the door to transforming society and their relationships.

books.title: The Metrosexual Guide To Style: A Handbook For The Modern Man
author: Michael Flocker
books.description: The old-fashioned, repressed, un-moisturized man has been banished to the hinterlands and a new breed is taking center stage.

books.title: Juliet, Naked
author: Nick Hornby
books.description: Nick Hornby returns to his roots—music and messy relationships—in this funny and touching novel that thoughtfully and sympathetically looks at how lives can be wasted but how they are never beyond redemption.
